column2: Yesterday I failed to eat breakfast or lunch. Today, I wanted a substantial breakfast. Cafe Bianco Googled up near the post office where I mailed off the last of two tax returns I spent yesterday finally getting finished by overruling a ‘tax expert.’ Nice space, lots of light, and available tables at 10 am. I am tempted to sit here and write for a while. At first, I was concerned that their excellent, simple but delicious menu would not leave me as stuffed as I desired. Then, to the side, I saw their special offering--bacon, lettuce, avocado, and tomato sandwich on sourdough. Excellent. I am well-stuffed and satisfied. Good coffee in a great cup I'm tempted to steal...I mean... tempted to ask if I can buy. I shoveled it down so fast I didn't get a photo of the sandwich. But here is a pic of the great cup and the remnants of the sandwich. I'll be back, perhaps for a couple of hours of writing if I can get it in before they get crowded. Surely they get crowded at lunch.

Food and drink are okay. Location and interior are great.  Had an egg & cheese sandwich on sourdough. Was pretty flavorless. Really could’ve used a sauce or spices and more variety in cheeses.  The hot chai latte was a better experience but only just. A bit too watered down and only warm, not hot.

Thank you for your comment. We appreciate the feedback! Next time you are unhappy with the quality, please let us know immediately and we are more than happy to accommodate your needs. We want to correct mistakes right away and make sure our customers are more than satisfied :)

I wasn't really sure what I wanted to eat for lunch, so I was browsing through Ritual and saw this place was nearby and wanted to try it. I got the Chicken Pesto Sandwich which came with pesto aioli, provolone, roasted peppers, arugula sun dried tomato on a dutch crunch bread. It was really good! The service was quick and very friendly. The decorations seems very cozy and a nice place to just sit. There was a decent amount of people just sitting and either working, reading, or having conversations while eating. There are lots of other things on their menu that I would like to try in the future. Highly recommended!
Great family run cafe, didn't get a chance to try their coffee, but got a Dutch crunch scramble egg and sausage, yum yum yum. Love this local gem that has a lot of history and great quality food.

Friendly locally-owned spot downtown- who knew that was a thing?! Fast service, tasty food, good place to work or have meetings. Pass by Starbucks with their union-busting BS, much better things await around the corner.
Very friendly staff and amazing food. Only slightly disappointed with the lack of gluten free options but apart from that a fantastic cafe which is well worth a visit.

This is my second time here in a week and it feels like the last long time family run spot in the FiDi.  The family is so nice and accommodating, and the food is excellent and well priced.  The ambiance is very New York feeling or older San Francisco.  I will be back over and over again.  The salads and wraps are excellent!

A great place to meet a friend, read or just sit and listen to yourself think. I love this place because it’s spacious, filled with light and not noisy at all. Has the feeling of a Kaffeehaus or bistro - in other words a European feel to it.
Food was excellent, wholesome  and healthy.  Ingredients were fresh and service was awesome.
Very nice place for breakfast or lunch. The staff is great and the food delicious!
Delicious spinach, egg white and feta wrap.
The eggs in my sandwich were fluffy and hot, so good!
Great food and coffee at a good price. Friendly service and staff.

Wonderful lunchtime experience!  This is a mom and pop run restaurant with amazing service and delicious food at a very reasonable price for the financial district.  I ordered their special hot meal of the day, which tasted like a five star restaurant cheese ravioli, with a beautiful kale apple salad on the side, but it was only around $12.50.  You order your food at the counter and pay, then they bring it to you when it's plated. Since the food is already prepared it's fast and lots of people also take it out.  Everyone was very friendly and helpful.   The older gentleman behind the counter took the time to explain their menu to me and their specials. Then the cashier poured me a glass of water and helped me carry my dishes to my table.  The sitting areas are clean and bright with an Art Deco style.  I can't wait to go back!
I was there on opening day in the late 1970s and Caffe Bianco has only gotten better over the years. A must-stop when in the financial district… particularly at lunch time! Wonderful!

I keep coming back to Cafe Bianco for breakfast and lunch. It’s family run so I’ve gotten to know the father and son duo, and they are wonderful! The prices are unbeatable in this city. Try the breakfast burrito or toast with almond butter for breakfast, and any of their sandwiches for lunch (they have a havarti with dill option, YUM!). Their coffee is also fantastic, the beans are from a local Bay Area roaster that makes them fresh for Bianco. I’ve actually bought their house blend beans as a gift for my parents down south, and they LOVE them! Highly recommend this place!
Good coffee good sandwiches. Is there anything else that need to be said.

If you're in the area, this is the place to hangout or do your work. It's a nice European style atmosphere. I usually get their sausage, egg and cheese Dutch crunch roll breakfast sandwich when I'm around. Customer service is wonderful. They have WiFi for customer to do work here. Plenty of space upstairs too, which makes this an ideal place if you don't want to deal with the crowd at Starbucks.

My favorite espresso place in downtown SF. I like it's European vibe and the excellent (I think father/son) team that greets and serves guests. Highly recommended.  Haven't tried the food, but all coffee and tea choices are excellent.

Beautiful and spacious old-style cafe for breakfast , lunches, or teas/coffee.  The portion is big and the varieties are unbelievable.  You feel welcomed there.  The second floor is a great place to take a relaxing break or make some strategic plans with your business or your potential clients!

A gem on the edge of the financial district.  Fresh savory salads made every day. If I could buy a subscription to a few meals a week at this place, I would! Very friendly staff, fresh, fresh, fresh options.  Also a great place to sit and chat.
Best sandwhiches in the northern hemisphere! If you're wondering the coordinates of this devine establishment, you can find it at 37.7900° N, 122.4012° W
Amazing! The staff were so friendly! The food was really good as well!

Had a business meeting there Yesterday. Very great and quiet place to meet. Unlike Starbucks that becomes very busy and music too loud, this place is really ideal to have meeting with you business partners. Here you can actually have a conversation :)

Great lunch spot in the fidi. I’ve tried about everything on the menu and haven’t been disappointed. Don’t skip the salad of the day display. Always some nice surprises in there like beets with whipped ricotta cheese and pistachios.

I've been going to Caffe Bianco for about 4 years. It's an independent sandwich spot with coffees.  The food is solid and they carry my favorite brand of Chai... which is Bhakti Chai, which makes it even better.  Either  owner and his son are always there, and the staff don't seem to turn over quickly.  The caffe has marble tables on the first floor and also has a mezzanine.  I recommend it for a break from the cookie cutter eateries that have taken over the Financial District.  Enjoy!
This place was delicious. And the sandwiches are huge. Everything tasted so fresh. 10/10 would recommend

Fantastic little cafe that is perfect to enjoy your coffee and pastry at your pleasure as you watch the world go by. The coffee is well made and the pastries are delicious. The decor is also very inviting.

It doesn't matter where my Financial District errands take me, when I am ready to have lunch or write awhile, I head to Caffe Bianco for the old-school, San Francisco café experience. Some cafés are so perfect it makes me want to cry. That's how I feel about Caffé Bianco. Last time I visited, the owner, Banny, mentioned he's been there 35 years, and I just read that the Hobart Building is over 100 years old.
I really loved having breakfast here. They serve great coffee and healthy breakfast. The chia bowl with fresh berries and seeds was very tasty.
Great lunch spot with good eats and nice seating options. Not overcrowded and not overpriced.
Great affordable place , love the atmosphere and breakfast
Best avocado toast in the area! Crazy good value for the price too! Nice staff and nice seat ins. Really like this place
Very healthy breakfast, good coffee and very friendly staff.
Excellent sandwiches. Was kind of bummed they stopped serving breakfast after 11am as that was primarily why we came. Guess we'll have to get up earlier next time
I love this little cafe. Conveniently located right off bart and muni, great people, and a good vibe. Good for lunchtime meetings, grabbing a bite to eat, or getting some work done.
Such a great experience. Great service, and some of the best food I've had in a long time. Definitely going back.
Love stopping in when I pass through town. It's a place of fine quality and genuine environment. The food and coffee are tasty too.
Fantastic food and coffee. Everything tasted fresh and homemade. Also, great and fast service, nice atmosphere.
Croissant was quite good and flaky. Nice quiet ambience early in the morning. Convenient location close to BART.
Perfectly made egg and cheese sandwich on sourdough. The type of place I could linger in for hours. Great ambiance. I'll definitely be back!
Incredible food and coffee and very personable staff. Loved the two story setting. I could spend hours just hanging out there

Two words....Canned ingredients. Canned mushrooms, canned artichokes.....Even chain pizza places know this is a no no. Very dissapointed. Never thought i would cone this far for horrible pizza and bland lasagna. I guess you get what you pay for.
Great coffee and impressed with the bagel sandwich. Definitely coming back here if I need a quick bite downtown.
cool spot, giant wrap, friendly service
Healthy breakfast. Friendly staff. It was pretty quiet in early morning. Breakfast egg-avacado burrito was very delicious.
I ordered delivery for breakfast. Eggs sandwiches. It was delicious.
Really friendly amd kind staff, loved having breakfast here. Excellent food & service.
Chicken Caesar wrap is one of my very favorite foods!  Love this little place
Nice meatballs and good sausages.i worked their in the eighties so i am assuming.i @m sure!I had problems with authority.looking for Richard carse.
This family run business is everything that San Francisco has been losing of late. So I make a point to stop here and direct my clients and potential clients here!
This is a great breakfast spot in the heart of the financial district. It's cozy but has a full menu.
Good home made food and very friendly service. The rstaurant have a feel to an European cafe.
my favorite hangout in downtown. great food, coffee and ambience. staff are awesome too!
Friendly service, convenient location and pleasant cafe to sit for a chat
Wonderful cafe , with wonderful people . Delicious quiche! And chai made with love . Can't wait to go back !
one of my favorite places to get coffee.  Not the friendliest people, but I didn't put forth much effort either
Nice staff, decent food and reasonable prices in downtown San Francisco
Great for breakfast food fresh and tasty staff excellent great family run cafe highly recommended ☺
Great place to start your day. Love the music! Benny and his son are great people!!
Just really delicious. Perfect for brunch.
Review is for chicken pesto sandwich only, it's delicious and fulfilling.
Awesome old world euro looking place with great staff and food. Wish SF had more places like this.
Lovely place! They have the best tiramisu I've ever had.
Awesome chicken sandwich with extra avocado. Great value!
Just stopped there for a shot of espresso - these people know their espresso! I hope everything else there is as good
Quiet place, great spot to stop by for a quick morning bagel and get some work done
Nice food, good coffee, and an excellent atmosphere!
Love this spot, really miss going here since the pandemic started.
Really nice little cafe, with good prices and friendly people.
Great food prepared by great people!
Food is fresh, made fast, and with care.
Cute cafe... sandwiches and wraps are great
Good breakfast fare (scones, egg-on-bagel sandwiches, etc) and coffee.
Amazing staff and wonderful bagel and lox.
Best chai tea I've ever had!
My absolute favorite Cafe IN SF.
Good service, good tea. A bit run down place
Excellent food and nice owners.
Great mocha, fresh OJ, friendly service
Solid but slow lunch and coffee spot.
Friendly staff. Good wrap
Breakfast sandwich is a must. Deli
Terrible. Slow service and horrible sandwich.
Pricey but good.
Just ok
Sadly closing today...:(
Hi Jay, thanks for your 5-star review. Just wanted to let you know that we have officially reopened! We hope to see you again soon :)
Serenity in busy San Francisco
Closed.
Hi Ken, thanks for your review. We're happy to let you know that we have officially reopened!
Great service.
Excellent.

It's awesome about the food and beverage. If you want to get a great day, start here!! Really really delicious toast, crispy on the outside, crunchy when bitten down, the green sauce is very refreshing and can be paired with soft fried eggs, and the price is very, very affordable!!! And the transportation is convenient, it's really worth it try it!!!
Yummy sandwiches!!!
They failed to heat my food.
